I purchased a copy of this book in December of 2006. If I need 
an 'adrenel=
ine' rush, I pick this one off the shelf and peruse the 
contents - if I ha=
d endless amounts of money, I would purchase a few 
of these 'exquisite' ar=
t objects. 

Elliott


--- In nihontostudy@yahoogroups.com, "Barry Thomas" =
<warlord@...> 
wrote:
>
> Dear Nihontophiles,
> 
> Just doing my daily traw=
ling for all things sword related when I 
stumbled across this link to the =
book "ROKUSHO":
> http://www.kanshoan.com/special/dtls_book.html
> 
> This =
Japanese website is asking 2,940 yen - on today's exchange 
rate that's AUD=
$27.67 or USD$23.81.  Of course postage is on top of 
that and I have no id=
ea what that would be, however, I paid AUD$60 
for it from a local collecto=
r who no longer wanted it and I was quite 
glad to have it.  I cannot find =
it on Amazon, but Wikipedia has some 
information on Rokusho:
> http://en.w=
ikipedia.org/wiki/Rokusho
> 
> I found this altogether fascinating and, for=
 a primarily blade man, 
very interesting indeed.  Some of the Wikipedia li=
nks under the 
listed catogories of Artistic techniques | Decorative art | =

Metallurgy may be of interest to many of you.  As John Yumoto once 
said, =
there is no end to study...
> 
> Best regards,
> Barry Thomas.

xt portions of this message have been removed]
